title: Newcastle reach agreement with Bordeaux's Henri Saivet in latest transfer news
title_page: Newcastle reach agreement with Bordeaux's Henri Saivet in latest transfer news | Daily Mail Online
text:
Newcastle have opened talks with Bordeaux over the transfer of winger Henri Saivet.
The 25-year-old is due on Tyneside with his agent as the clubs try to complete a £4.5million deal.
It could prove a busy week for the St James' Park club as they continue to press for the £10m transfer of Jonjo Shelvey from Swansea too.
Newcastle are expecting a busy few weeks with Bordeaux winger Henri Saivet set to spark a transfer splurge
The 25-year-old scored for Bordeaux against Liverpool in the Europa League group stage earlier this season
Bordeaux have a verbal agreement in place to sell Saivet for £4.5m with a further £730,000 following based on appearances.
Newcastle are putting themselves in a better position than rivals as they are willing to pay the majority if not all of the transfer fee in one go as opposed to over a number of years.
And Bordeaux coach Willy Sagnol confirmed an agreement has been reached with the Premier League club at his press conference on Monday.
Sagnol said: 'Newcastle and Bordeaux have reached an agreement for the sale of Henri Saivet. Saivet has been the most important player of the first six months of this season.
Newcastle manager Steve McClaren will hope Saivet is the first of many this January transfer window
Emmanuel Riviere (right) and Cheick Tiote (left) share a joke on the training pitch ahead of the midweek game
'He wanted to leave the club as he was in need of a new challenge. He's been here for a while. I've given him my blessing to leave.'
Bordeaux midfielder Wahbi Khazri added: 'Henri's depart will have an impact. He's a good player but it will give others the chance to step forward and take their chance.'
Magpies boss Steve McClaren admitted Saivet is on Tyneside having a medical and discussing terms, saying on Monday: 'We are just waiting for the outcome.'
Siem de Jong walks outside during the first-team training session ahead of the game with Manchester United
Yoan Gouffran looks on during training while Jack Colback is challenged by Ayoze Perez during a match
The club are also close to the signature of Swansea's unsettled England midfielder Shelvey. The 23-year-old, who has fallen out of favour with Swans interim boss Alan Curtis, has told friends he's ready to sign a five-year deal at St James' Park.
The two clubs are expected to tie up the details of the transfer fee this week, and Shelvey is already set on the idea of working for former England manager McClaren.
